body.p:
Provost Marshalls Office
Scott County Kentucky

The undersigned Provost Marshal of Scott County Ky states that some time in March last, one W. H. Cohorn was under arrest, by the Civil authorities of Scott County -- He had a preliminary examination before the Presiding Judge of Said County, & admitted to Bail in the sum of three hundred Dollars, with G. W Corham & John McLin as sureties on his Bond -- After his release from Jail I arrested him immediately as a deserter from the 18th Rgeg Ky Vol Infantry & delivered him to Capt Thos. H. Moore Pro M 7th Ky District at Lexington Ky -- by whose orders he was sent to his Regiment -- which was then stationed (I think) on the Nashville Rail Road

Jno, N, Long
Pro Mar Scott Co Ky
Sworn to before me by Jno N. Long this 21 Dec 1864

Sam. W. Long
P. J. Geotown
Exhibit for Petition of John Macklin & Geo W Cohorn
